REVIEW: Nov 2 2005	Good Hotel for Happy People	Recently stayed 4 nights at the Alexis Park Hotel ($75/night, try and get a suite for that price in Sin City). The hotel is directly across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel which is always fun to run into the musically inclined. We stayed in a standard Monarch Suite that has a large sitting area (living room) connected to the sleeping area. The space is nice to have people over, just make sure you pick up after yourself if you don't want your friends to see your unmentionables. Wet bar and fridge are good to keep snacks and cold drinks. Bed was a bit uncomfortable due to lack of padding. Electrical plug in the bathroom didn't work. The entire hotel complex is undergoing renovation, but we weren't bothered by it. If you don't need pampering and just want a good room at a great price then check out the Alexis Park.

Oct 31 2005	Bad disgusting never again!	I wish I had read reviews about the Alexis Park *before* booking.The place has a fabulous lobby and looks nice from the outside, but the rooms were atrocious. The first room we were given wasn't made up, smelled horrible, and there was a lot of dried blood on one of the pillows. We demanded another room, and were given one in much better condition, though the bed was squeaky, there were gaps in some of the multihued bathroom tilework, mystery stains on the sofa, and one dead cockroach. On the plus side, it looked like the exterior had been recently painted and the pool areas looked clean.All this for $180 a night.This establishment advertises itself as a "resort" but should really be your last resort.

Oct 30 2005	The Alexis Park is always fantastic	Two weeks ago my family had a huge birthday party for my cousin and I have to say that my experience at The ALEXIS was great. The front desk people have always been professional and prompt. The pools look good and parking is always available. The rooms are big. It is like staying at an apartment. I visit Vegas about five times each year and I have always enjoyed my stay there. It is the only place I will stay at.

Oct 25 2005 	Don't stay at Alexis!	I stayed at the Alexis for a conference last week. What a disaster! The entire resort is just *tired* -- looks like a 70s style motel that's been cheaply renovated. They're halfway done repainting the motel buildings into a terra cotta stucco faux finish, but it looks "faux" and the colors from building to building don't match. The rooms were rehabbed, yet outdated. Some of the entryway tiles in my room were cracked and replaced with mismatched tiles. Other tiles were loose and would move when I stepped on them. The tiles around the shower were also "peeling" -- i didn't think that tiles peeled, but I never stayed at the Alexis before either - you learn something new everyday! :) Also, the remote controls for the TVs didn't work and one of the lightbulbs in one of the lamps were burnt out when I arrived. The worst part of my stay was when the water main broke and there was no hot water in the entire resort. It was the same day as my checkout and I would expect that one member of the staff would apologize and/or ask me how my stay was -- nope -- the front desk just handed me a receipt, no questions asked or apologies given for the water problem.This is definitely NOT a resort, it's an over-sized motel.

Oct 25 2005	Great hotel great value	My family and I enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We drove all the way from Wyoming for my wife's sisters wedding. I was very glad to have been able to park our family van right by our hotel room. The room was much bigger than we expected and since we arrived ahead of schedule the font desk was very accomodating about checking us in a little early. One gal at the front desk (cant remember her name) was helpful in recommending where we should take our children for some fun.I would like to thank the entire staff ESPECIALLY the housekeeper who kept our room so tidy.

Oct 21 2005	Great Stay-Great Rate	We spent three nights at the Alexis Park Resort and we had such a good time. The front desk agents were so accomodating and our room was so much nicer than what we had expected for the rate we paid. Every one of the employees we encountered were so friendly and replied to our requests promptly. We will definitely return to this hotel!

Sep 25 2005	Disorganized so not a resort!	After reading all the reviews, I was skeptical about staying her. Mainly, for the bad reviews regarding the cleansiness of this hotel. However, this hotels biggest issue is a disorganized front desk. Since, we were on a budget for our wedding, we decided to give it a try anyway. Upon checking in, we were given a Queen Suite, after reserving a Loft Suite. After, spending 45 minutes trying to straighten this out, the person at the front desk tried to charge us for the room we didn't even check into. To make matters worse, our card, which we held the reservation with, was charged for the stay. Even though we paid cash for both the stay an incidentals, prior to arriving. When we discussed the matter with the front desk, they said no charges were placed on our card. We had to call the credit card company, while at the front desk. The card company had to tell them, "yes, this card was charged by your hotel". As for the room. Once, we received the right one, it was clean and comfortable, except for the upstairs shower. It had severe mildew, and we actually had to buy cleaner to get it clean enough, for us to feel comfortable to take a shower. Overall, if I was on a budget when visiting Vegas again, I would look elsewhere, and only stay here as a last resort. By, the way, still waiting for the credit on our card to appear!
Sep 22 2005	Not what it seems	More like a dorm. The rooms do have a fridge and a sofa but beware that "two beds" might mean one bed and a sofa bed.

Sep 18 2005	Not a resort	This hotel had bad service in all areas except the housekeeping was decent. This place looks great from the website photos (which must be at least 10-years old) but look at the other reviewers photos that show how truly shabby this place is. Paint and plaster are peeling off the buildings around the pool area and the interior of our suite was very cheap quaility (plastic tub) with very poor finish work. There even was a hazardous, sharp piece of metal sticking up from the floor where a doorstop had broken off, the floor tile was cracked with chunks missing, and we had a room in the "refurbished" wing! The location was bad with lots of construction going on Harmon Road. We love to walk everywhere but it was very unpleasant to walk to nearby areas from this location with too much traffic and poorly lit street and sidewalks. If you have time to watch TV, forget about it. Channel selection and reception were both poor.We had ants in the bathroom and the air conditioner was horrible. The first night we'd go from sweating to freezing, with no happy medium. A little sign on the thermostat said not to set below 70 or the unit would freeze. We turned it down as low as possible and by the 3rd night, the AC unit next to our bed was dripping water all night with a water torture effect. I only got some sleep after using ear plugs. Someone was sent to fix it and all they did was turn the thermostat back up! On the same day, our electronic key stopped working, which made another extremely long wait in line in the lobby a necessity. As it turned out, they had us checked out of our room 2 days early! Another guest in line ahead of us, said it was his 3rd attempt to get checked into a room and one time, they actually put him in a room that was already occupied - it wasn't our room either, so they must routinely "accidently" check guests out of their rooms prematurely. The front desk service was extremely slow and each visit required a very long wait in line with other disgruntled guests. The thing that really ticked me off was their internet service. I signed up for a full day at 10 a.m., only to later learn the cut-off time is at noon! So, I had paid $10 for full day service for only 2 hours of actual service. After calling the front desk twice, they finally said they would reverse the charge. I later overheard another guest asking for a refund for the same reason, so this too must be an ongoing problem. After we checked out, I called the front desk and they confirmed that no extra charges were incurred on our account, only to later see that darn $10 charge show up on my credit card bill a month later. That really ticks me off because it is hardly worth my time to fight a $10 charge and they know it.This was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. If you are considering a stay at the Alexis "Resort," save your time, money, and peace of mind by staying elsewhere. It is NOT worth the savings you may think they are offering.

Aug 14 2005	A home away from home	I booked my stay at the Alexis Park Resort while I was attending to a convention. I got a great deal when I booked my stay in advance. When I arrived to check in at the front desk, I only waited about five minutes before they served me. I asked if I can check in early and they checked me in quickly. They were very accommodating. The staff and security were friendly and very professional. The room I was assigned, was very nice, spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable too. The room had a living room area and a kitchen bar. Plus internet access (for an extra charge). Room service was good and they made my bed and restocked the towels twice in one day. I will defiantly book my stay again. It was like a home away from home.

Aug 5 2005	Nice but with some problems	We checked in quite late and were greeted at the reception by a rather abrubt, unfriendly receptionist who seemed to take forever checking us in. When we checked out, the service was no better. A different man at reception arrogantly said that the room would be charged to my credit card, and then when I said I had already paid for it through expedia, he just snapped at me at said, 'ok, fine', then moved on to the next customer. No apologies or nothing. Of course, when I got home, I glanced at my credit card statement and noted that I have indeed been charged for the room! What a joke. So, I now have to contact expedia and inform them so I can receive a refund. On a more positive note, the rooms are quite cheap. We stayed in a bungalow and it was lovely, spacious with a nice jacuzzi half way up the stairs. Criticism time again - the air conditioning was inadequate in the room. It wasn't even cool in our room, and bearing in mind 115 fahrenheit temperatures, you kinda need good air-conditioning. Also, our room was round the back of the building and faced a waste ground or something (cant remember exactly what). However, the breakfast was lovely, and inexpensive. The hotel offers free parking which is good and it is in a nice location, close to the strip, yet in a quiet position considering proximity. Again, another criticism is that, for some reason an outside attendant constantly felt the need to whistle loudly (to call in taxis I think), so I would pity anyone whose room was near the reception area as that would be all you would hear all night long! Yes, so overall review is good and bad. I would probably stay there again if only for the lovely bungalow.

Jul 27 2005	you get what you pay for	After refusing to pay $300 a night for hotels on the Strip during Memorial Weekend I opted for this "resort." I definitely do not think that resort is an accurate way to describe this place, it reminded more of an apartment complex. I had not done my research on trip advisor prior to going so I was not sure what to expect. I must say that had I read the reviews beforehand I would not have stayed here. BUT, I was pleasantly surprised. Check-in was quick and easy.The room was very big and looked like it was newly remodeled. Overall it was clean enough, I did not notice any stains on carpet, towels or sheets and I felt comfortable walking around barefoot. I am somewhat of a neat freak so this is a big deal to me. We did have a problem with housekeeping in that we left the room late afternoon and came back that night to find that our room had not been cleaned. We were only able to get clean towels after calling the front desk but room could not be cleaned as housekeeping staff had left for the day. the next day we made sure to call housekeeping prior to leaving for the day and thus ensured that our room was clean once we returned. The location is far off the strip but close to Hard Rock. I did not notice the airport noise but that is probably due to alcohol consumption....if you are a light sleeper the airport is definitely close by.

Jul 27 2005	Don't Sweat the Small Stuff	If your the kind of traveler that needs alot of personal attention from hotel staff, this is not for you....If you want to stay some place economical and well located consider this place...Had the crown loft great space...The entrance to the hotel is misleading...the front of property does not look like the rest of the hotel. Renovations seem forever on-going, but after a few days you think they may be finished. Large pool not open. A/C wall units (3 in all) had some leaking problems and noisy. Front desk are not quick to the phones. Some no answer at all or busy signal. Room was clean, well stocked, furniture and room was in good condition and very spacious. Spa tub was nice. Would stay again, just keep your needs in prespective.

Jul 20 2005	Bad Experience	My flight to vegas got cancelled, and they refused to refund me my money (prepaid), whereas circus circus did. Its off the strip and there are better places on the strip, or off.

Jul 14 2005	I had a great time at the hotel	My friends and I went to Alexis Park in Vegas for my friends birthday. I was very happy with our room. It was big enough for my friends and I have a plenty of room. It was (4) girls so you know we needed plenty of room. THe staff was pleasant and the grounds were well kept. During my stay I even saw a beautiful outdoor wedding. THe hotel had done a really nice job. Overall my stay was excellent and I would go back again.

Jun 9 2005 	Worst hotel ever	I stayed at the Alexis Park in Vegas recently. The hotel is in very bad shape. I was supposed to stay 4 nights, but left after 2. On the first night, the air conditioner broke. So they moved me to a room that had dead bugs laying on the bathroom floor and ants crawling all over the bathroom sink. It was disgusting and I highly recommend staying anywhere else. The website made the hotel look great, but it was a different story once I got there. Stay Away!!!!!

Jun 3 2005 	Alexis Resort Problems	1) TV sets (approx 30" x 30") in Alexis Park hotel rooms - were not secured, or bolted down. Could be a hazard. 2) Bathtub/shower unit did not have slip resistant bath mat or other slip prevention device. After housekeeping cleans tub unit - surface is very slippery - could be hazard to children or adults. No hand rail in tub area for elderly guests. Also, there is no bathroom fan.3) Pool, contaminated and closed for several days. Notices appear to be from the local health department. This situation continued for several days -without full disclosure from staff.4) Air conditioning did not work in all Alexis Park units. Fellow traveler had a room without air conditioning while temperatures exceeded 100 degrees. The windows do not have screens or security devices.5) Full Disclosure of Hotel Charges (no room document/staff untrained) The phone lines were often busy - I was unable to get an outside line for up to an hour. Not good in the event of an emergency. Room service charges a mandatory 18% that is not disclosed on room menu. Internet is available for $12.95 per day. (At time of booking room - I understood it was free.)6) Mini kitchen (small sink, refrigerator, 2 drawers and 2 good sized cupboads, bar with 2 bar stools) is not fully functional for guests. The refrigerator temperature is set too high - and food freezes. Turning down the temperature, caused refrigerator odor. The room we rented had a queen bed and a couch/bed. The room could sleep 3-4 people - but the coffee maker was a single serve - for 1 person. No can opener, no microwave oven (to warm tepid room service meals), no toaster, and no dishes or silverware. Hotel staff did not have dish cloths or dish towels. I have rented several hotels along the WA and OR coast with a mini kitchen - and ALL have a few dishes, a few pieces of silverware, hand can openers (dish cloths and dish towels) and a microwave oven. 7. Movie selection - is not current. TV programs: NBC, Fox, ABC, (Alexis Resort Personal Billing channel - that never had an accurate billing posted for my room, Station/Computer program - non functional),ESPN, ESPN 2, ESPN News, CNN, Headline News, Cartoon Network, Weather Channel, Las Vegas channel - non functional, TBS. NO PREMIUM CHANNELS.8) No Shuttle service to the strip or to the airport. From Alexis Park to the strip - is a very hazardous section of roadway. Cars and taxis are going from 45- 60 mph and make quick entrances into and out of properties along Harmon Ave. There is a sidewalk. Staff will tell you that the Hard Rock Hotel - across the street has a shuttle (to Las Vegas Ave) every hour on the hour. The Hard Rock shuttle does not charge for the service. 9) Alexis Park room amenities: Iron/ironing board, 5 hangers, queen bed (springs were terribly noisy), 3 drawer chest of drawers, 2 nightstands, couch/bed chair, 2 bar stools, small mini kitchen with single serve coffee maker and 2 coffee packets/2 condiment packets. Several towels were dingy and some had terrible stains, stains on the sheets as well. Laundry staff may not be using bleach for the laundry. No care is taken to provide clean looking towels and sheets.10) There was plenty of hot water for 2 nice long showers daily - and the hotel room was clean. My room had 4 sprinklers - and a working smoke alarm.11) Room keys stop working after 7 days. At the end of 7 days, the room key did not work. Staff did not alert guest to this standard issue at time of entry to hotel. Nor did staff member apologize for the inconvenience to guest. Front desk staff, not courteous to guests - a lack of common courtesy appeared to be standardThe stay at the Alexis was for business. It is known that several business associates stayed one night - and found better/less expensive housing in Las Vegas. For the record

May 28 2005 	Never Again	I would rather sleep at a truck stop, the help would certainly be friendlier.After arriving at 4:00 I found a check-in line 15 people long and only two people working the front desk. After the 45 minute wait to actually talk to the desk staff, I was told that my reservation had been cancelled. At that point, the desk staf was simply done talking to me. "Call Orbitz" I was told while they called the next victim in line.Orbitz did fix my reservation, which was entirely a hotel problem and I was checked in. Luckily, my room was clean and remodeled. Other guests attending the convention I was with were not so lucky.The main pool and hot tub were condemmed by the county health department. The third floor open air patio over the convention center hadn't been cleaned since what looked like a new years eave party. The bar was horribly dark and smelled of 20 years of smoke and spilled drinks.I had a bit of trouble with the $10 / day high speed internet access in my room and called for help. After prommising to have the technician there as soon as possible, I was lucky to figure it out myself after waiting 6 hours.If you used the second pool you had to share it with ducks each evening.On Friday evening, every teeny bopper in town showed up to share a room and hang out by the pool, right outside my front door... there must have been twelve 20 year olds sharing one room.Room service trays stayed in the halls all afternoon.The ONLY saving grace for this place was my 700 square foot remodeled room. I would never stay there again if given a choice.

May 28 2005	Great room decent price unique gem of a hotel	Well, I just got back from my most recent trip to Las Vegas. I stayed in four different hotels and had four totally different experiences. This hotel started off very very negative in that the line to check in was a monster and there was one check in girl who barely spoke english. The manager did come out to help and that moved things along. From an organization standpoint this place gets one star. That said let me tell you why I rated this four stars. First let me say there is no casino on property which is good. The place is super quiet and the rooms are nice nice nice. I stayed in the Crown suite and only paid $115.00 per night. A great bargain for a room that is two floors two bathrooms and a king sized bed. It even had a hot tub in the stairs very cool. I would highly recommend this place for a honeymoon couple that does not want the distraction of heavy casino traffic. You still getr great views of the strip. I cannot give this five stars only because I stayed at the Bellagio this trip and it is now my worldwide standard bearer for hotel rooms. This far exceeds the Aladdin which was my previous favorite but not a good as the Bellagio. I recommend highly. Feel free to e-mail me with any questions

Apr 30 2005 	Not really great but the pools open 24 hours.	We stayed here for a convention that was happening at the Alexis Park resort in August 2003. We ended up having to stay in the farthest section of the hotel, all the way in the back. At least we had a car and we could drive over there with our luggage. The room was average. It was a suite with a pull out bed. If I recall there was a kitchenette. One thing that turned me off was the shoddy cleaning job that housekeeping did. I remember walking around with socks after they had cleaned and then looked at my socks and they were black. I don't think they ever mop up the floors in the kitchen or bathroom. Not to mention I could tell they didn't vacuum. The only thing that I enjoyed about the Alexis Park was that the swimming pools (there's 3) are not monitored and you can swim in them at any hour of the day. We were at the farthest so farthest from the lobby and hotel staff could not hear or see us. We would go swimming and sit in the hot tub late at night after we can home from partying. That was really fun. Especially since the water was so warm from the hot August days. I wouldn't really go back except for the swimming situation.

Apr 15 2005 	Long lines at checkin	I booked over the internet and got a really good deal but learned a good leason....you only get what you pay for in life! The lines at check in were long, which i guess is normal for Vegas but to top it off the front desk clerks were so rude! They did not even apologize for the delay and really need a leason in customer service. The room was OK ( i liked the coffee pot) but housekeeping was not good-stained sheets, and they did not empty my trash. In fact, the garbage can did not even have a liner. The only good thing about the hotel (or should I say resort?) was the food-fabulous. By the way, where are the villas they are talking about?

Apr 9 2005 	Only if there's a conference...or an amazing deal	The only reason why I stay here is because of DefCon, a 3 day binge-drinking-war-driving-goon-dodging-sleep-oppressing debauchery of a weekend. Being that DefCon is the only source of revenue for this hotel; they charge $159 a night for a basic room, which likely goes for $70 any other day. Be aware that some of the entry level rooms lack a wall between the bedroom and sitting area. This didn't matter for my party, we still got loads of space, but the wide open space was such a waste. Actually, the wide open space was useful for housing a herd of underprivileged and malnourished hackers who came to Vegas with nothing more than their Bluetooth converters. For conventions/parties, the setting is great. 2 storey complexes centred around several pools, lush landscapes, fabulous lighting, and all in the middle of the desert! Directly outside my room was a wicked party at 0300hrs. The impressive grounds make this place a little bit above a consummate dive.The rooms are nothing to run home screaming about. Simple bed. TV with limited channels (not that it mattered for the weekend I was there), bathroom with a plastic tub and a bloody LOW FLOW shower head. The kitchen thing was nice, you can jump on the CAT, ride down to wal-mart, and get yourself milk, cereal, red bull, vodka and such, and all have it stored in your fridge to save yourself from the, um, food that they have for sale. Interior decorating is nice. Desert colours. Nice track lighting above the "kitchen", overstuffed couches, generally, a nice room to crash in. The air conditioning units work a little bit too well for my wussy Canadian body. I'm still amazed that those freakin' things can freeze your hands like its winter.Security guys were funny. Daft, as they kept disturbing sunbathers to ask if they were ok. Yet again, this was at 0800 on Sunday after a HUGE party, and they were likely concerned about people lying on their back after enjoying a few. Sort of scary those guys have had guns. Maybe it's because I'm Canadian.At the end of the conference, on Sunday at like 1500hrs, the resort was desolate with the exception of a few families checking in. I felt bad for them. Only stay at the AP if you're present for a conference (ON SITE) or you're in Vegas for a reason other than gambling and getting wasted. If you want quiet or something for the family, I recommend staying at the Westin which is a block north.I'll definitely return...for def con 13.

Mar 28 2005	Nice Quiet close to strip.	I just stayed here for 4 nights and I was satisfied. If you want a quiet place to retreat too after your time on the strip this place is great. If youre looking for entertainment around your hotel, don't stay here. Our suite was nicely furnished and very spacious. The staff was nice and we never had any lines at check in/out. It was a little cold to go swimming, but they said one pool was heated, but we couldnt find it. We were at the casino's so much we didn't have time to swim. We had breakfast twice at Lucky's in the Hard Rock (right across the street), it was really good! Also you can ride the Hard Rock's shuttle to the Strip. It runs every hour (10am to 7pm) from the Hard Rock; just ask the Valet where to pick it up.Overall for the money we paid we were satisfied and would recommend this hotel to people who want a quiet place without the frills. Its just a nicely furnished, spacious, clean place to lay your head at night.They are doing construction to the landscaping, driveway entrance, and front door entrance but that didn't bother us. The lobby has rendering posters up for future remodeling, but that hasn't started yet

Mar 26 2005	Good If you can't get a room anywhere else	I stayed here 3/20-3/23 as a last minute trip to Vegas. It was a bad week to stay because of NCAA Tourney, Spring Break, and Conventions. Everywhere on the strip was ridicousely priced (excalibur was $190 USD a night, MGM was $300 a night), so it was either the crudey airport hotels (see reviews),downtown (seedy) or the Alexis Park Resort. I came across Alexis Park Resort on TripAdvisor and saw the reviews and decided to give it a try. I got a room from i4vegas for $80 USD a night, a good rate for that week.Yes, it is going through a major overhaul, the lobby is coming along and you can tell it is going to be nice. I wasn't lucky enough to get a remodeled room, but the one I got wasn't bad. The Room was very clean and large (calling the room a suite is an overstatement, its more like a very big room). The TV got Very Poor reception, but you do get free webTV. The Shower head is very low for some odd reason, so if you are tall its going to be tought to take a shower. If you go out late like I do (I dont usually dont get back to my room until about 5:00AM), be aware they do not have 24 hour maid service, their maids go home a 4:00PM, I found this out the hard way, so I couldnt get my room cleaned the second day I was there, but they did provide me with some clean towels. The place is a little dark, buy hopefully the upgrades will solve that. There are a few stray cats that hang around the grounds ( I also noticed some feeding bowls for them, so they will not be going away anytime soon). Parking is very convienent and is across the street from the Hard Rock. Check-out could only be done at the front desk which kinda stinks. All in all, the place is good to get some sleep, its close to the strip (about 1 mile), rooms are clean, and its not in a bad area. I would stay there again if I had too because it is clean and it does seem safe, but I think I would wait until the remodeling is done, which doesnt seem like its going to be done for a good few months.

Mar 21 2005 	Motel anywhere USA - not for Vegas fun!	Hated this place - it's poorly lit (in Vegas, go figure!). Even local cabbies - if you could get one - couldn't find the place in the dark. The tremendous road construction made the hotel nearly impossible to get in and out - forget trying to walk anywhere without risking your life. The suite is a nice concept, but pointless unless you plan to hang around your room. We never used the living area. One phone was broken; one tv barely functioned. We could never get regular coffee for the cup-at-a-time coffee maker. One day, they left all decaf. The "bellboys" are a joke - who needs your bags unloaded (first tip) when you can drive them to your room yourself? Expect to pay a second tip when a different eager bellboy delivers the bags to your room. There are no vending machines except soda and ice cream, so bring your own snacks, and we had to wait forever to attempt to get breakfast in the restaurant. The "kitchen" has a small refrigerator, but nothing more. Cabinet space, but nothing to put in them. Even the trash cans never got liners. Pools are pretty, but good luck finding the spa.Would not ever stay here again or recommend it.

Mar 11 2005	What a Peaceful Place	I have stayed at many Hotels in Las Vegas with gaming. The 24/7 action made me feel tension and stress. Always on the go. I stayed at the Alexis Park and it was wonderful. With the non-gaming resort I could have both worlds. The beautiful and mature landscape made me relax. I could not believe the rooms. They were all suites. The suite had everything. It was clean and comfortable with (3) pools for me to enjoy. I look forward to staying there again.

Feb 26 2005	Large rooms great value!	I thought this hotel was a great value, paid $89 for a spacious suite. Fast check-in and quiet environment, unlike the casino's. But close enough to the strip, which they provided free shuttle to. Our room was clean and everything was in working order. Under renovations, but it looks like it will be gorgeous when it's done. I'll be back!

Feb 23 2005 	Nice!	I'm surprised at all the bad things that I've heard, but I don't know what you'll have seen or experienced. It was an excellent stay for me and my wife. Great personnel, great food, great service! Definitley cheaper than other 4 star hotels (yep, they are 4 stars in my opinion).

Feb 6 2005 	Here's a good review.	After reading all the trash reviews, I thought I would add my positive comments. The front desk personnel were very helpful. I had a miscommunication on my reservation about the type of room I reserved which they quickly corrected with little fuss. My room had been totally renovated (in building 23) and was very clean. My only complaints are: a minor squeak in the air conditioner, the fireplace didn't work (I assume it was turned off for safety reasons, but then why was it advertised?), and several machines in the workout room were old and in poor repair.Good points: Good housekeeping. Comfortable bed. Huge whirlpool tub. Clean furniture. Good soundproofing kept down airplane noise from nearby airport. Very adequate business center for checking emails, etc. Nice landscaping where it had been redone. For the money, much better than some of the other 3 star rated places I have stayed at in Vegas. I will stay there again.

Feb 3 2005 	Don't even think about it	This property is definitely not a 3 star hotel. I got my reservations blindly through Hotwire. DO-NOT-DO-THIS! Prior to the purchase of my reservation, I had a phone conversation with a Hotwire Representative. The examples of 3 star hotels in the area given to me, included hotels like the LaQuinta & the Marriott. What I got was The Alexis Park Resort. It looks VERY good in published photos. However it is currently under going a major restoration and as of this date, is far below the level of Motel 6.I had asked for a room that had been renovated. I was given a room that had several new items to include a brand new refrigerator & bathroom fixtures. However the rest of the room, especially the bed and heater/air conditioner, were very old & in dire need of replacement. The bed was rock hard & squeaked loud enough to wake me when I would roll over in the night. The air conditioner/heater put out a musty smell when operating & was so loud I had to turn it off to get to sleep.There's no exhaust fan in the bath room, only a small window. As far as the remodeling....they are painting the place RED. Kinda looks like the entrance to Hell. In my opinion it was poor value & any Motel 6 would have provided more sleeping comfort!Just pass on this Hotel & Hotwire as well because after repeated emails they still say..."We have conducted a review of this property and have concluded that our star rating is accurate, and we do stand by that rating"Do yourself a BIG favor & look elsewhere.

Jan 23 2005	It wasn't five star...	We found the room to be spacious and clean. When we arrived there is construction, the staff was friendly and helpful. The first room we were given was not made up, we were given another room with no problem.The room was very large, the beds were comfortable, and the bathrooms were both clean. Plenty of towels.The fireplace didn't work, which would have been nice. If you left food on the counter there were ants. But the room was not expensive and just the amount of space you had was worth it.

Jan 7 2005	I have Stayed in Worse	I got the Alexis Park for New Years Eve after a bid on Priceline. I read the reveiws on here and was really scared. The front entrance still has some construction, but its not that bad. The lobby was very nice and my desk clerk was polite. I got a basic two room so-called suite. The outside of the building looks very old, but they are repainting and it makes it looks quite a bit better, but you can still tell that its old. The room I was in was recently renovated. They did an ok job, but cut so many corners that would not have cost that much more to do right the first time. They put a beautiful granite top on the bar... put they used the old painted 100 times wood bar frame below and hack cut the fridge in it. The interior doors are all old and should have been replaced. The lighting is very bad in the room. They have a sprinkler system and the sprinkler heads are hanging down about 1 1/2 inches. They should have some kind of covering around them to make a nice finished look. The bed was kind of hard, but the sheets were clean. Bathroom was fairly clean, but felt dirty because of the very poor lighting. I would stay here again if I got the place for dirt cheap and I could not get anything else in Vegas. Book Somewhere else like Palace Station or Las Vegas Club if you want a cheap room.

Dec 10 2004 	Worst stay ever!!!!!	Booked this hotel hoping to find a nice non-gaming hotel close to a conference I was attending. Got to the hotel and wasn't sure if it was open or not. Could not even walk on the sidewalk to get into the front desk because of construction. It was late, I got my room and went to go and find it and was nervous because there was tons of plastic and caution tape covering the walkways and no lighting. Finally found it and opened the door to a nasty smell. The kitchen fridge was making loud noises as if it were going to explode. My room was freezing so I tried to turn the heat on or at a minimum the airconditioner off and the second I turned a button the cooler made a loud noise and started dripping water onto the t.v. set under it. After I grabbed towels to dry it off I sat down on the dirty couch to turn on the t.v. and the t.v. didn't work. I then decided I'd try and take a warm shower and the shower was filthy. I went to plop down on the bed and hit the bed as if I landed on concrete. Layed down to try and sleep and the thunder of airplanes flying over were so loud my room shook. Management and the owners of this location should close this hotel down! If you are making improvements good, but don't try and misrepresent the hotel and charge outragious prices for a complete dump and dangerous nights stay! I will never stay at this location or recommend anyone else to stay no matter how the improvements go. Do NOT BELIEVE THE PICTURES YOU SEE WHEN YOU RESEARCHING THIS HOTEL. IT IS A COMPLETE DIVE!!!!!!

Nov 28 2004	Nightmare Stay Away!	Stay away from Alexis Park!My family encountered the following problems during our 6 day stay:No hot water for showers, two mornings.Squeaky heating/cooling unit, woke everyone up at 5:00 am, took two days to repair.Shower Door fell off, was never fixed correctly.No sheets on downstairs bed on arrival.Fireplace did not work.Light outside the front door, was burned out, like many other rooms.Bad cable T.V. reception.Annoying perfume like smell in room.Right next to L.V. airport, you can clearly hear the planes taking off and landing.Many areas under construction, including front entrance.Outside Hot Tub was shut down and drained, during the last two days of stay.Uncomfortable beds.The Manager, Linda Hutchison was rude and very hard to contact.Linda has very poor people skills and did not seem to be very concerned about all the problems.To be fair, most of the other people working at Alexis Park, were nice and professional.To summarize:The Alexis Park Resort is a very poorly managed and maintained Hotel.Our stay was extremely stressful and unsatisfactory. Do yourself a favor and stay away, It is by far the worst place I have ever stayed at.

Nov 9 2004	Worst place in Vegas!	Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere but here! The rooms are dirty, the service poor, the grounds dark. Was there for a conference and a large group of people just checked out. Not worth the money or pain of staying here.

Nov 8 2004	The Worst Ever	This was the worst place I have ever stayed. They overbooked and bumped me. The suite I thought was going to be great, "when I got in it the following night", was run down, the windows all had plastic over them so I had no view or light and the Manager left much to be desired. Be very careful in your travel plans and do not stay there.

Nov 7 2004 	Only if the sidewalk is too cold...	I stayed at the Alexis for the SEMA trade show. Totally misrepresented. Overpriced.Paid $92 per night on Hotwire. Front entrance is all torn up with construction, lobby is tired and unkept. Service is likely weary of handling all the complaints. Indifferent desk staff. Room was dirty, had footprints on tile, carpet dirty and unraveling, bathroom had hair and dirt in corners, Internet modem was missing, nice man came to fix it and all that did was charge my room for the service and never worked. Neither did net in Business Center (a closet with 2 pcs and a printer) Complaints were handled by a somewhat helpful desk manager, Linda, who found another room the next day, which was much cleaner but I believe it was done to quiet me down.This room was better but far below par and none of the property was as described. Internet required a jumper cable, they said I could buy it from the desk for $10. Fat chance. Oct 4 2004 	Don't do it!!!!!!!!!	This "hotel" was grossly misrepresented on their Web-site. It was by far one of the seediest, tackiest hotels I have ever seen. It is under construction and we weren't even sure it was open when we pulled up. There were very few cars in the parking lot and not a sole to be seen. The area is very poorly lit and it made me very uncomfortable. My room smelled like Mothballs and I had an asthma attack as soon as I opened the door. We ended up moving to a major casino on the strip and not staying there, because I literally couldn't breath in my room. I was there attending a conference and our session had to move on the first day because you couldn't hear over the jack hammers and construction noise. One of the attendees from my conference had someone try and break into her room. When she spoke to the hotel manager (who was a woman) she was told "that happens all the time". That's not exactly what I would call a compassionate customer oriented person. If you like seedy, tacky hotels that smell nasty, then the Alexis Park is the place to stay. If not, I recommend a hotel chain you have heard of.I will tell everyone I know to NEVER stay in this Hotel. It reminded me of what hotels would probably look like in downtown Baghdad

Aug 25 2004	Enjoyable resort like hotel	My husband and I really enjoyed the Alexis. It is a bit off the beaten track and quiet. We stayed in a 2 level suite with a small hot tub in the room. It is an older hotel but well run and comfortable.

Aug 14 2004	ups and downs	I was attending a conference so enjoyed the quiet, small scale of the place; well layed out; oasis-like; much greenery in this small-scale, unprentious place. About a mile from the Strip, which I walked during cooler May weather.Rooms are spacious "suites"; separate bedroom, a plus for those with kids or different time-clocks. Kitchette is simple, no stove, but decent frig. space to keep juices, milk, sandwiches for breakfast, lunch. Of the 3 pools, only one is working; the others make a good waterview in this desert area; lounging at any time is pleasant among the trees/birdcalls.Good casual and fancier restaurants on site, but no competition for Vegas dining. Friendly staff. Resort lacks the quiet glamor of the past, when "suites" were for upscale patrons. Has a slightly rumpled look, a bit out-of-place in glitzy Vegas. That's what I liked about the place! You have all the glitz/glamor a quick cab or shuttle ride from resort.

Aug 10 2004	Great value just off strip	Quiet retreat just off the strip. Each building only 2 stories high. Parking close to room. Surprised at large accommodations- 2-room suite. Hotel does not have gambling, so very quiet. Good value alternative to large hotels on strip. Although hotel is older, it is clean and well kept. Would stay there again.

Aug 10 2004	Where's the 25 acres of gardens?	My main problem with Alexis Park is that they WILDLY misrepresent themselves!!! If they called themselves something along the lines of an economy lodging sort of close to the strip, I'd think they were at least a somewhat decent value for the money (I paid about $65 a night).As it was, I got this hotel thru hotwire, where it represented itself as being a 3 1/2 STAR SUITE RESORT HOTEL. Of course as soon as I got the name of the hotel I looked it up on TripAdvisor and saw all the negative reviews, so at least I was prepared for what I got...which was a property that looked like a cheaply made over apartment complex from the 70s which some company figured they could, with the right advertising, pass off as an all suites hotel. When I called up the hotel directly, I was put on perma-hold and forced to listen to a shpiel about the property which, amongst other exagerated claims, tells about 25 acres of gardens. I'm not sure where those gardens are, but they certainly aren't anywhere near this hotel! The landscaping is pretty much like any $500 a month, get your first month's rent free type apartment complex, which is pretty much what this place really is! The rooms are NOT suites, the furnishings are incredibly tacky and cheap, the air conditioner is god awful loud, the walls are paper thin...HOWEVER, my room was pretty darned clean!

Jul 13 2004	Not as bad as some say...	I booked a room to this resort via Expedia for a very, VERY resonable rate considering we went for the 4th of July. We stayed July 3rd-5th (including a Sat. night) for ONLY $139! Check in only took about 10 minutes. The lobby was well kept and had many blooming potted orchids on the counter. The person behind the desk was friendly and offered good directions to get to our room. We were surprised at the size of the resort! Our room was clean and everything worked, although we did not try the iron. It was not a true suite because the bed was not located in a separate room. However, it reminded me of a studio apartment. You could tell where the "bedroom" was in relation to the "living room." The "living room" area had a couch and squishy chair with a coffee table and lamp. There wasn't much drawer space but that was not important to us. The television offered a limited selection of channels. The wet bar area had a scary older mini fridge that worked, no microwave and a coffee maker that made a personal cup a coffee each time (i.e. it did not have a coffee pot). The bathroom was clean and well stocked with linens and soaps. The shower head was a bit low but the tub was a nice size. We weren't given any bubble bath the first night but the 2nd night a bottle was left for us. The queen bed was old and squeaky but still comfortable. The air conditioning was nice since it was over 100 degrees outside. There were 2 units controlled with one thermostat. One unit was placed blowing cold air onto the bed which made sleeping difficult but the vent was adjustable and the problem was quickly solved. No internet available for free. You can pay $9.95 to use it from noon today to noon the next day, no pro-rated time. No free phone calls whatsover. We only used the smaller pools, which were open 24 hours. They were very shallow and had issues with insects floating in the water. The 24 hour hot tub was a good temperature, not too hot, but it was also full of floating insects. The larger pool looked nice but we didn't get a chance to use it while we stayed there. During the day towels were plentiful in the clubhouse but by night they were all used and not restocked. It is quite evident that this is not the newest place. However, it's also not the most run down place as some say it is. I'm not sure how the "stars" and "diamonds" ratings on some website work, but this place is definitely nicer than the Motel 8 that some people we knew were staying at (and they paid only $10 less). Our check out was super fast, only about a few minutes and we were done! Considering that we went to Las Vegas during a busy holiday weekend, this was a great experience for us! We got more than we expected since we paid so little for the room. My boyfriend and I will definitely consider staying at Alexis Park Resort again.

Jul 12 2004	It's a motel not a resort!	Alexis Park Resort is a motel. A very large motel with run-down rooms and very plain surroundings. There are something like 15 buildings in their charmless complex. My husband and I just returned from a road trip out west where we stayed in wonderful resorts in Utah and Arizona. Alexis Park is seedy and run-down. We bought our room night on Hotwire (beware the one that's called "best value" with resort and suite as indicators. Yes, our room was large but it was run-down, almost thread-bare, the bath plumbing was miserable and everything was old and used looking.We know there are really no deals to be had in Vegas but this confirmed it.

Jul 3 2004 	Student Council Adviser Stayed there 7 days and had nothing but trouble	Got there(In 100 dgr weather) with 16 people all had wrong rooms had single beds in them even though I reserved them in Nov 03 (10 Rooms) with two double beds. Then was moved the AC did not work and for 3 days they tried to fix it and could not moved again (3rd time) and even then the AC fouled up had to get maintenance at 2AM to come in and stop the AC racket and defrost, what a nightmare..Mgr comped 4 days after my complaining .. Said he would comp 6 but reneged on that. Not very personable(his name was Dave. and saw another mgr named Linda Hutchins and she was even more unpleasant.. Can't see my self staying there again even for free...However the grounds were nicely kept and the help(except Mgrs) were very pleasant and tried to help as best they could.

Jul 1 2004	Not as bad as I thought it would be!	I just returned on June 30 after a three night stay here for a conference. After reading some opinions I was worried. My room was large and clean (I was concerned about this).The sink had a odor to it but I was only over there to use the counter to iron on. The pipes were loud from the room next door when someone took and shower. The shower needs to be replaced but I think they are doing that building by building. We stayed there, I am sure, because we were there with high school students who were housed with familes. It is not somewhere I would stay when we visit Vegas but it did fill our needs.

Jun 17 2004	Not fabulous but I'd stay here again	My first try posting a hotel review, please forgive any errors I make.Stayed here for one night (Saturday 6-12-2004 on a Priceline $90 bid, total was $106.02); not bad for a Saturday night only stay(?). Overall a good stay. I would stay here again.Took approx 30 minutes to check-in (not bad for 2 pm Saturday afternoon in Vegas?). No mention of Priceline, just the typical "Your room has been prepaid, require a credit card for incidentals,". All friendly smiling reservation clerks on a Saturday afternoon in Vegas! Off strip, older resort with no casino. Located across street from the Hard Rock. 3 pools in complex (1 larger with jacuzzi area), many two story buildings with the pools located between. Complex and room was very clean. Everything (buildings, rooms, decor, etc) looked used and slightly worn but ok. All suites resort, mine was a smaller king bed suite but plenty big. Breakfast bar area had 2 chairs, wet bar/sink, small refrigerator, some storage shelves/space, no dishes or silverware. Sitting area had sofa sleeper, comfy chair, end table, coffee table, 32 inch TV on top of storage cabinet (only two small drawers). Sleeping area had two end table, a small desk with chair, and comfortable king size bed. There was a small (3 foot or so wide) closet with 6 hangers along with an iron and ironing board. Bathroom had nice big tub and shower along with a small sink and counter area. Also a hair dryer which I didn't use. Room had two air conditioners controlled by one thermostat; worked great as temp outside was 100 but it was nice and cool in the room. Southwestern decor, not my favorite but seemed ok. There were several lamps around the room so lighting was very good, even the bathtub/shower area had a light with a separate switch. Easy access to parking completely surrounding the complex so you could park (free) relatively close to your room. Not much of a view of Vegas and the landscaping was ok but not great.

May 5 2004	you get what you pay for	Our group stayed two nights at the alexis park. i have read many reviews of this hotel some very good and some very bad. but lets all use some common sense and realize that overall you get what you pay for. this is an older hotel and at one time it was probably very beautiful. it has become run down with time and is in need of some major improvements, but, with those improvements the price increases accordingly ......... we payed a total of $150 for two WEEKEND nights compared with $249 for one weekday night at the rio. the alexis park does need some work and is not a 4-star hotel ....... but you are not paying a 4-star hotel rate.

Apr 27 2004	Never again	We just returned from Las vegas last night. We stayed at the Alexis because I had stayed there before and found it convenient to the strip with out being on the stip. The time I stayed 4 years ago the room was of need of updating so I checked to see if they had updated the rooms and they said they had and were under new management. It was somewhat convenient as we were traveling with a baby and thought since its on one level would work out best. The rooms were missing light fixtures parts with bulbs hanging down and bulbs out. Forget the mini bar area didn't even have a coffee pot so requested one and was told there were no cups or coffee. Big help. The groups that were there were very loud and were not pleasant to be around at the pool. Won't be returning.

Apr 23 2004 	Poorly Staffed Run-Down Party Hotel	The Alexis Park was nothing like I expected. Checking in and out can take as much as an hour due to the lack of front desk staff (and phone calls to the front will be ignored). To make it worse, it's difficult to get a cab at the Alexis. During our stay, the rock band Phish was playing 3 sold-out shows nearby and the hotel was full of Phish "heads". They checked in with cases of booze, coolers of beer and little clothing. One afternoon they had a party out at the pool with a DJ: thumping music, booze (the hot tub was full of screaming people tossing cans of beer and spraying water all over). One of the rooms even had a music/light show going on inside. You can do much better than this hotel. The room prices are too high for such run-down accomodations and lack of staff (polite as they may be).

Mar 29 2004	Okay place for an okay price	This hotel was just okay. The term "suite" is used loosly. It was just a large room. There was no microwave, but there was a large kitchen area with small fridge. It was a strange setup (nothing to cook with but a lot of room for cooking.) Beware not all "Monarch" suites have two rooms. TV reception was terrible. They made an attempt to fix it, but it didn't help. Only 1 small pool is heated. The other 2 are not and the large pool was never open during our stay (Spring Break 2004) There are no tennis courts (some sites say they have them) and the monarch suite does not have a jetted tub (only a large garden tub.) The price was okay but not great. I think I will stay at the Residence Inn next time (not far down the road off Paradise.) This place was nothing special.

Mar 27 2004	We were PLEASANTLY surprised!!!	We booked our flight/hotel package online...the first time we had ever done so....just before we walked out the door to catch our flight I found this site and printed off the reviews to read on the plane.My wife and My hearts sank the further we read on about the Alexis Park...we decided that our holiday wouldn't be ruined as we'd only be sleeping there anyway....ya...ya...ya.We found the front desk clerk very friendly upon checking in so that was a plus.We were totally shocked when we got to our room and found this gorgeous suite(Monarch Suite) complete with a separate bedroom and TV with a huge jacuzzi tub,separate shower for two and enough towels for a family of 6....not sure why you'd want to take your family to Vegas however....this town is NOT a place for children. We had room service the next morning and the attendant could not have been more pleasant and polite. We found the pool areas clean and never a fight to find a place to lounge in the sun....oh....they may want to fix their lounge chairs...few would adjust to sit up......and perhaps March weather has not yet warmed the pool water....was a bit cold to swim in even tho the outside temp was in the high 80's. Other than that we had a wonderful stay there.....we enjoyed the fact that you could get away from the gaming areas by being at a hotel without gaming....nice and quiet. We will come again......and will certainly be recommending it to our friends.

Mar 23 2004	Poorly Run Business	I did not stay here, decided to stay on the strip. However - although they told me my account was credited for the deposit, it has not been in five weeks. I have left FIVE messages over a period of two weeks and no one has called me back even though I have told them how many times I have called and asked for someone to PLEASE CALL ME! Mar 22 2004	After numerous stay still love Alexis Park!	An excellent choice for non-gaming stay; as frequent visitors to Vegas, Alexis Park has remained, after numerous stays, a favorite place to stay. They have a bar/grill and a nicer restaurant, and a large lobby with numerous chairs and couches, as well as a small gift shop.It has REAL suites, with even the smallest, the Monarch, being like a small apartment. Pricing for the Monarch is usually under $100!The property is laid out like an apartment complex, with great grounds to stroll through, numerous pools and spas; the fitness center here is free for hotel guests (unlike so many other LV hotels). They have a great fitness center, too - machines, spa, showers ...with more towels available than you can count - his and her wet areas are, of course, separate -Can't believe the negative reviews - the entire resort was recently sold (stayed last Dec. 2003), and all the rooms have been remodeled. All changes from here on should be positive, due to capital influx.This is a non-gaming resort located on Harmon west of Paradise, just across from The Hard Rock, where you can catch a shuttle to the strip, if needed.One word of warning - although units are large, there is no dining table in the suite - kitchen/ bar area has fridge and sink, but no microwave -also, there are no stairs if you get an upstairs suite.

Feb 25 2004	Not the best	Just visited here. It is an OK place. The common area was nice and the restaurant food was super. The rooms are something less than I expected. There are better deals for the $$. It is also about 9/10 ths of a mile from the strip.

Jan 24 2004	Less Than Expected	Stayed there recently for a business meeting. Overall an OK place to stay, but many basics were lacking, including in-room coffee and a complimentary newspaper. Jan 12 2004	Do not stay here!!	This is possibly the worst hotel ( operates like that of a cheap motel) in Las Vegas. It took over 20 minutes until the phone was even picked up and then we were on hold for another ten minutes and all this to put in a wake up call. The property does not have a very safe feeling to it, to many dark areas and is not located in the best part of town. We will never stay here again.

Dec 2 2003	A lot better then expected.	We arrived @ 9 am Saturday morning and did not think they would let us check in until check in time. We arrived @ 9am Nov.23 and left 24th Sunday @ 2:00. I would say it is not for everyone becuz it is far from the normal out of contro Vegas Hotel...

Dec 1 2003	Alexis Park - no welcome here	We visited the Alexis Park all the way from the UK and although we couldn't grumble about the price -our deal of $70 a night was good value - we were very disappointed with our welcome. Not a bad deal but if you're going in November, as we did, and are prepared to wait till you get there we reckon you can get a better deal on the spot.

Nov 4 2003	Great	I was suprised to see all the negitive reviews. We had a bedroom and a spacious living room. Room service was good. And the rooms were wonderfully decorated and very clean. The lobby was spacious and nice, my friends and I hung there till 2am, because it was so compy and nice to relax.

Sep 17 2003	Not Worth The Money	As a 30 year resident I have stayed at many of the local hotels. With that said I can assure you that you do not want to stay at Alexis Park. On the weekend that I stayed there they were hosting a company pool party until 1am. Loud music could be heard inside my room making it very hard to sleep. There was a walkway just outside my window and the conversations of those passing by could be heard inside. The windows dont have adequate sound insulation. I sent a letter to Alexis Park but never received a response.

Sep 15 2003	No hassles and spacious!	I don't know what happened with all the other people who stayed her but this is one of the better places I've stayed in Vegas. I'd stay here again anytime. Don't expect much luxury--it's more like a one-bedroom apartment. They are all suites, and are spacious, the beds are comfy, and the lobby area is enormous! It's right over by the Hard Rock and Ellis Island. I liked that it didn't have a smoky casino and that it wasn't right on the strip. Some of the fixtures are a little cheap, and the shower head must be good for a four-foot tall person, but that's about it for the downside.. I guess if you just plan on staying in your room and ordering room service, this isn't the place for you, but if you're looking for a convenient, quiet place with nice large units, it's perfect! Tip: try to get an upstairs unit if you plan on sleeping in. It's popular with families so there are lots of slamming minivan doors and arguing siblings in the morning.

Sep 3 2003	Not bad as expected with reviews	Read all of the negative reviews. Was expecting to be disappointed, but was impressed upon arrival at the Alexis. Rooms of the $69 suite were very large and neat. TV and air conditioner in each room - small fridge was a great benefit. Grounds and pools very clean and well kept. The only somewhat bad thing I can say is that the air condition had a slightly moldy smell. I needed a band-aid from all the walking we did. Gift shop was closed (out to lunch) but the front desk was quick to send Security to our room with a handful of band-aids free of charge. Shuttle service to the strip was just across the street (make sure you check service schedule at Hard Rock for changes). If you want or expect the Aladin, Mirage or Bellagio stay there, otherwise your stay at the Alexis should be pleasurable. We'll definitely stay there again and recommend it (if you're not looking for slots in the lobby). Nice experience.

Aug 27 2003	Do not stay here	We were sorely disappointed with our stay here. The first room we went to had no working lights. Second was fine until food was brought in, then the ants came. Only then did they offer a room upgrade or any kind of compensation. We didn't want either. We quickly called around and moved to the Amerisuites and enjoyed the rest of our time in Las Vegas.

Jul 31 2003	A Little Above Average	Strengths - Close to airport. Nice clean pool. Towels provided on pool chairs. Decent gym. Decent friendly staff. Jul 23 2003	Save your Money	Horrible service, horrible rooms, horrible location.

Jul 9 2003	Somewhat disappointing	Had to change rooms - A/C unit was making such a racket that no one could sleep. Jun 2 2003	Loved the Alexis	My sister and I did extensive research and ended up booking at Alexis Park. We wanted a suite, OFF the strip, a pool and a great rate. We stayed a full week in June of 2001 and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. Did not eat in the cafe but did use the pool and found it to be fine. Our suite was large, the rate was excellent, the limited contact with the staff we had was fine and the location was great. Cleanliness level seemed to be fine; I have no memory of any problem. Sep 18 2009 	Great experience both times!!	Unbelieve prices and good accomadations! I have family in Vegas whom my parents visit monthly. Sep 14 2009 	Very good hotel and casino	If you think this place is not a great value, you are just a hater, and probably always complain .....We stayed here this past weekend, and everything was perfect......NO ROACHES anywhere.....The staff was very friendly and couldnt have been more of what we wanted them to be like....The rooms were very clean---big----and the price was right....$50 Friday and Saturday for a 2 room suite....The buffet was also priced right and the food was very good...We will for sure try to come back here next time when we go to Vegas and also tell our friends the same.....

Nov 12 2008 	Not fancy bit very reasonable prices.	The Hotel Casino is not on the strip.... a fair drive from it, but much quieter. Jul 27 2008	By golly spend the extra $10 and stay elsewhere.	Abandon hope, all ye who enter here. This may go down as one of the worst hotel experiences I've had. Here are the facts, ma'am:1. The television - which looked like it was from a closeout special a decade ago - had a snowy picture.3. Thug types run amok in the complex.4. While #3 happens, the yellow-shirted security guard clips his fingernails. No, I'm not exaggerating; I (unfortunately) saw it.5. The ice machine on our floor did not work.6. I asked for a room with two beds, and while I did get this, there were two ROOMS as well, which only compounded the air conditioning problems.7. We had plenty of hand towels but no wash clothes.8. Because I booked a room for two consecutive nights but on under two different reservation numbers, I returned after my first night to find myself locked out of my room. She did not say, "Two beds, three nights, three different rooms." Good grief.9. Much of the staff seems paranoid. This is one thing I don't have hard evidence of; call it a general feeling.10. May 29 2008 	Pleasant Surprise	As we wanted to stay away from the high weekendrates in Vegas we booked this hotel for 3 nights (fri-mo), paying 98euro in total through Expedia.Location:Though on the Boulder Strip it's location is ok really. It's a 15 minute drive from the Strip if you take Flamingo. Close by are Sam's Town and Boulder Station. There's a new Walmart Supercenter across from Sam's Town.Hotel: The hotel has several buildings. We think they are in good condition. We had a (big) corner room facing the (cold) pool. We were pleasantly surprised as this room turned out the a two room, two bed 'suite'. Though there's not a lot of furniture in the rooms..there's a sofa and two tv's. The bathroom is ok, but the fan is really(i mean REALLY) loud (goes on when you turn on the light).The carpet was brand new and we noticed they were replacing carpets in other buildings to.Icemachines are not located on every floor so prepare to hike...Pool : Small, but has a hot tub as well. Plenty of good seats and beds, both in shade and sun. Towels are provided, but we found the box empty most of the time. A call to housekeeping was enough to fill the box again though.Parking: Though quite a pain at night, during the day there's enough parking availabe. At night just use the free valet service if you don't want to wait for a free spot.Casino: We didn't gamble here, but found the casino a bit cramped and smokey. Registration is in the Casino. The other reception they used to have south of the hotel towers is closed now.Buffet:We were pleasantly surprised. We had breakfast here and the quality of the food is good. They cook eggs to order and have fresh donuts. Price was less than 4 bucks with Players Card which is really cheap.If you are looking for a cheap, clean room this is a good place. if you are in vegas as a tourist and you have just a few days here....you better choose a hotel closer to the Strip. I suggest Terrible's which is within walking distance of the Bally's/Paris corner of the Strip.

Mar 5 2008	Problems with this hotel which is really a motel and casino.	This hotel is really a multi-stored motel behind the casino. There were parking spots in front of motel rooms, but these were mostly occupied by local gamblers so sometimes you are forced to park far away in garage. No indication spaces near motel were reserved for room guest. The room was humblely furnished, had a big living room and a nice size bedroom. However, the bath room smelled awful from mildew/mold. Nearest ice mache did not work. Had warning that all items in room were inventoried so do not steal anything. Also, be sure to secure main door with lock device when in room. Dec 27 2007 	Cheesy trailer trash style but we loved it!!	We were in Vegas for 10 days. We stayed here for about 5 of the 10 , both weekday and weekend. We found our suite to be clean and the cleaning staff, front desk staff to be friendly, very helpful. We needed extra towels once but had to go to front desk to get. The rates ofcourse change dramatically from weekday to weekend but that is typical Vegas. We gambled here , had a great time, and found weather you are at one of the big hotels or the smallest out of town casinos, winning or losing is the same. We actually preferred gambling at this hotel/casino because of itssmaller size and pay outs were more often and more $$$ than the big glitzy hotels/casinos on the strip. The food at the buffet was great,,, I mean a buffet for $5.99 or $7.99 is a great value,,,and the food is good!!!! The most you waited in line was maybe 15 minutes with about 20 people in line. We saw lineups at the Paris hotel with 200 people waiting to get in to eat a $12.99 breakfast. Hello!!! Tired of buffet?? Try the Yukon Grill, which is in the Arizona Charlies ,upper level, this restauant is first class, food is fantastic and the service is #1, the Chef even comes over to talk with you.... You must try this gem , and the prices were reasonable... Other thing I like about this place was no waiting for a slot machine there are plenty to go around,,,lots of payout machines to get your cash/winnings...Downside, well yes the neighbourhood is a little seedy, and yes there were punks hanging out on our stairwell once , but a quick call to security and they were chased away... Dec 25 2007 	Why Bother?	I'd gambled at Arizona Charlie's Boulder previously but never stayed at the hotel until my most recent trip. Dec 9 2007	Stinks!!!	Could not breathe because of stinking heavy cigarette smoke. Owners should install some sort of clean air machine or something. Would have stayed longer if the smoke hadn't been so bad

Oct 16 2007 	Great for a basic accomadation for a low price.	We stayed here one night. We are a family of 4 adults, one tween and a toddler. This afforded us reasonable and convenient accomadations for a very reasonable price. The rooms are large -- consist of a sitting area and a seperate bedroom and bath with a very large closet. Jul 24 2007	Great bargain for a suite	Stayed on a very busy weekend 7/7/07. Booked the suite since we would have our 6 year old granddaughter with us. Surprised at how big the suite was. Entering from the parking tower to the casino we were confused as to were the check in desk was so we asked an employee on the casino floor for directions. Good value in the buffet and cafe with friendly staff also. I would only stay here if you have your own car. It's a bit far from the strip or downtown to take a taxi which might get expensive. We plan to try the Decatur location even though it cost more just to see if we like it better but will stay at the Boulder location again also. I was worried that it would be a dump because of the low price but it was fine. Yes we have stayed at nicer places and some not so nice and paid a lot more.

Jul 24 2007 	Unfortunately this is where you end up staying when the strip is booked	I think we stayed here 1 or 2 nights with another couple and we were not staying at Cheap Charlie's because we wanted to. Jul 16 2007 	All that and a bag of chips	Arizona Charlies is a small casino on Boulder highway. We ( a family of 5 with two teens) stayed 4 nights here for a BMX race at Southpoint .  The location, off the 215 at flamingo, was easy enough to access for all of Las Vegas. Access to a vehicle is a must, esp. in the summer. The temp. was triple digit teens the whole time we we there. A few large Casinos are nearby but everything is a drive. The Rooms- They are as the other reviews state; nothing fancy.We rented two King Double suites. Two rooms,Two beds, T.V.'s couch,table and ample storage for clothes. We kept Three bicycles in one suite with room to spare. The corner suite was a little bigger. And the sink in the room was funky. I tried to be critical of everything knowing that I would write a review, and really could'nt find anything wrong. No mystery stains, comfy beds and sanitary toilets. Tokeing housekeeping got fresh towels. We paid rack rates , thur arrival and Mon. departure and it came to $400 total for both rooms! Such a deal. If you're a family traveling on a budget, this is a very good value for your hard earned cash. The Casino- Plenty of Penny and Nickle machines. Lots of video poker and keno. Most are older (1 or 2 years) It was never crowded, and finding a machine was pretty easy. A small but decent Race and sports book. It closed early though, so if you like to play Harness, go to Sams Town down the street. Bingo can be had 24-7. We played a few times. Games called rather quick Payouts were good. Table games were small and a seat could be found even at peak times. Only two crap tables. Lounge act was rather silly but better than the drone of slots. No live Keno. Not too smokey. Lots of locals.The food- Basic eats. The Buffet was inexpensive, Hot food, Fresh and plenty of it. We ate at least one of our meals of the day there and everyone walked away full, even the picky teens. Same for the 24 hr.Sourdough Cafe. Try their Strawberry shortcake. If you eat the whole thing and get sick, it's your fault.The Staff- I did'nt find a single Grouch. Everyone was happy and helpful. A rare thing indeed. Overall- Because the Hotel is separate from the Casino, One must walk outside to and fro. This creates the problem of walking around at all hours with large sums of cash in hand. the staff has provided Armed Security Guards on bicycles roaming the property. I saw no less than three in one morning while throwing all the equipment in the truck. I felt safe at all times, and that's not an easy thing for me. Because the rates are so reasonable, There were quite a few traveling workers here.They work long hours and just want to sleep when they get back. Our rooms were on the ground level, and I did not hear unneccesary noise from abouve, although the kids did in their room.  There are valid reasons not to stay here, But for us, it fit well and We will be back.

May 23 2007	Not a good location or safe place	Well we just needed a place to stay as we were visiting family in the area. May 16 2007 	Remember this isn't "The Strip"	First of all, remember that you aren't staying on the Las Vegas Strip.
